instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here that shuts itself down when stressed. I thought initially it was bad battery because it was indeed bad. So I replaced it three times and same thing. Decided putting in an original battery that's working perfectly on another machine and problem persists, so I discarded battery issue. I then started digging for the problem. As lots of these boards have GPU issues, I decided to flash GMUX with DOSDUDE method, but problem persists. ASD detects no issues with any sensors. The machine has problems with power connected and just on battery. Using genuine(bought directly from apple) 85W magsafe charger, so charger is not the issue here also. A strange thing I noticed is that when running on battery, if I launch coconut battery, even with GPU disabled, it gives some peaks of more than 60W of consumption, probably an error on sensor readings... I verified <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>/21 and <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51 and they read ok. Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/35 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> just in case. Same issue, although read consumption lowered in average after replacing them, but still having random shut downs, also no matter if original battery or replacement one and no matter if it's on charger or on battery. I'm going nuts with this machine, it's a rabbit hole to hell...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message:
Same problem in safe mode?

If you disabled GPU, remove also <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>/01.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Didnâ€™t test in safe mode neither removed those resistors. Will do it on Monday and let you know

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: I removed the resistors, same problem. In safe mode the problem appears to not occur, probably because of the lack of video drivers, so the machine does not draw much power.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Check starting in SMC bypass too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Not happening in SMC bypass mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message:
Then must be a problem with a SMC sensor.
Install HWMonitor and check for strange values.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: I tried HWMonitor, but could not find any strange values...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: I'm suspecting SMC itself being bad, but have no donor boards of this model to take it from.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message:
Did you test with original battery from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/2012 for sure?
I saw many weird issues on this model with new chinese batteries.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Yes, tested with original battery, taken from working laptop with never replaced battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: As I told, also, problem occurs either on battery or charger power with genuine 85W power supply.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message:
These machines have also strange behavior if no good battery connected.

Instal gfxcardstatus and test the machine with iGPU and dGPU also.
See if only fails with discrete GPU enabled.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Discrete GPU is permanently disabled, as told on the first post. I killed it with DosDude method.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message:
Never tried that method.
Hardware mod suppose more work, but may be the solution of this problem.
Just try it, if have time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shutting Off Intermittently
threads.message: Testing it again now... Now HWMONITOR is telling me CPU RAIL (CPU Total) is consuming a whopping 65W(!!!!!). Think maybe I found where the problem is, but how to solve?
